text: On 23 February 2018, at least 45 people were killed and 36 others injured in two car bombings and a shooting in Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility. == Attack == On 23 February 2018, two suicide car bombs exploded in the Somali capital of Mogadishu. The first car bomb went off after militants breached a checkpoint near the president's residence by shooting at security personnel. The other detonated in front of a hotel away from the palace. 45 bystanders were killed and 36 others injured. Five attackers were also reported dead. == Responsibility == The Somalia-based Islamist group Al- Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack via its Andalus radio arm, stating that both its drivers were suicide bombers. == References == Category:2010s in Mogadishu Category:2018 in Somalia Category:2018 murders in Somalia Category:2018 road incidents February 2018 attacks Category:2010s road incidents in Africa Category:21st-century mass murder in Somalia February 2018 attacks Category:Attacks on buildings and structures in 2018 February 2018 attacks Category:Attacks on government buildings and structures Category:Attacks on hotels in Africa Category:February 2018 crimes in Africa Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in 2018 Category:Mass murder in 2018 February 2018 attacks Category:Road incidents in Somalia Category:Suicide bombings in 2018 February 2018 attacks Category:Suicide car and truck bombings in Somalia Category:Terrorist incidents in Somalia in 2018 Category:Somali Civil War (2009–present) Category:Building bombings in Somalia Category:Hotel bombings
title: February 2018 Mogadishu attacks
